title: Audio-FLAN: A Preliminary Release
author: Liumeng Xue (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Ziya Zhou (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Jiahao Pan (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Zixuan Li (Inner Mongolia University), Shuai Fan (Beihang University), Yinghao Ma (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Sitong Cheng (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), ..., Wei Xue (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology)
relevance_why: The paper introduces a unified audio-language dataset that directly aligns with my research on audio generation and understanding tasks, particularly in leveraging large datasets for training models in speech and audio synthesis.
background: The paper addresses the challenge of training unified models for both audio understanding and generation tasks using a large, diverse instruction-tuning dataset.
contribution: Audio-FLAN introduces a comprehensive instruction-tuning dataset that combines diverse audio tasks to enhance model capabilities in understanding and generating audio, achieving over 100 million instances across 80 tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous datasets in the audio domain are often fragmented or limited to specific tasks, lacking scalability and diversity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work aggregates and standardizes data from various sources into a singular dataset that supports both audio understanding and generation tasks, greatly enhancing model training possibilities.

key_innovation: The innovative construction of the Audio-FLAN dataset enables systematic instruction tuning across diverse audio tasks, paving the way for more robust audio-language model performance.
real_world_impact: This dataset has the potential to significantly advance research on unified audio-language models, fostering innovations in audio generation, speech synthesis, and multimedia applications.
limitations: The preliminary release may lack extensive validation across all tasks and might require further refinements to fully utilize complex audio generation techniques.

new_terms.instruction tuning: **Instruction tuning** is a process in model training that involves fine-tuning on diverse task-specific instructions, improving the model's ability to generalize across tasks.
new_terms.audio-language models: **Audio-language models** are models designed to process both audio input and language, enhancing their capability to understand and generate audio in conjunction with linguistic data.

open_sourcing: Audio-FLAN dataset is available on HuggingFace and GitHub.
